net.sourceforge.JDash.gui
Class AnalogGauge

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.JDash.gui.AbstractGauge
      net.sourceforge.JDash.gui.AnalogGauge
All Implemented Interfaces:
PaintableGauge, SwingComponentGauge, SkinEventListener
public class AnalogGauge
extends AbstractGauge
implements SkinEventListener, PaintableGauge, SwingComponentGauge

This is a basic analog gauge. An analog gauge can be configured to emulate almost any sweep hand gauge. A gauge of this type can be configured to limit the range of motion, control the low and high range positions, define a set of important ranges.
The gauges neele is created by adding shapes with the addMainNeedleShape() addLowNeedleShape() and addHighNeedleShape() methods. Each added shape will be rotated arounds it's (0,0) axis to corrispond to the angle value that this gauge is going to display. So, the shapes you add need to have their coord space designed around (0,0) being the gauges pivot point. Remember also, that in the Computer world, the pixels start in the upper left corner of the panel. So, a point with a value if (10,20) is 1o pixels to the right, and 20 pixels down. Also, the needle needs to be disigned with the points along the Y axis at X=0 as the length of the needle.
So, if you want to create a simple stright line needle with a 5 pixel tail, and a 20 pixel needle, you'll want to add a line shape with it's 2 points set as (0,5)(0,-20).
The calculation for setting the angle of the needle is quite simple. You set the min/max paramter values with the setValueMin() and setValueMax() methods. You then set the min/max needle angle in degrees with the setDegreeMin() and setDegreeMax() methods. As the parameter value moves between the min/max values, the needle angle is calculated as the percentage between min/max value and min/max degree.
eg. Set the min/max values to 5/40. And set the min/max degrees to -90/+90. If the parameter value is at or below 5, then the angle will be set to -90. If the parameter value is at or above 40, then the angle will be set to +90. If the parameter value is somewhere in between then the angle is calculated as 

 
  radians = (getValue() - getValueMin()) / (getValuemax() - getValueMin()) * (getDegreeMax().radians - getDegreeMin().radians);

The normal direction of the needle is left to right for increasing values. If you want the needle to rotoate right ot left for increasing values, then the values you set with the setDegreeMin() and setDegreeMax() simply need to be reversed. IN otherwords, make the minimum greater than the maximum.

setNeedleResetDelays

public void setNeedleResetDelays(int lowNeedleResetDelay,
                                 int highNeedleResetDelay)
set the low and high needle reset delays. This is the time in milliseconds that must pass for the needle to reset itself automatically. So, if the current needle setting does not exceed the high-needle for x ms, then it will be reset back to the current needles point. Pass a value of -1 to have the needles NEVER reset themselves. You can manually reset the needles with the method resetHighNeedle() and resetLowNeedle(). You can also put buttons on the screen that link to these reset methods. see the addButton() method.

Parameters:
lowNeedleResetDelay - IN - reset delay time in ms. -1 to NOT reset.
highNeedleResetDelay - IN - reset delay time in ms. -1 to NOT reset.

setClockwise

public void setClockwise(boolean clockwise)
The default is to set the sweep of the hands to move clockwise, but you can reverse this by setting this value to false.

Parameters:
clockwise -

addButton

public void addButton(GaugeButton gaugeButton)
Add a button to this gauge. The button must have one of our supported button action string codes. These are the oNLY buttons this guage supportes. The action codes are defined in the AbstractGauge class. The static constants that start with "BUTTON_ACTION_xxxx"

Parameters:
button - IN - the button to add.

setDegreeMin

public void setDegreeMin(int value)
Set the minimum angle in degrees. This value will be linked to the setValueMin() value. When ever the paramter contains this value, the needle will be set to this angle in degrees. The angle is a 0-up reference. so, a needle pointing straight left will have a degree value of -90.

Parameters:
value - IN - the minimum needle angle in degrees.

getDegreeMin

public int getDegreeMin()
Get the minimum angle in degrees.

Returns:
the minimum needle angle in degrees.

setDegreeMax

public void setDegreeMax(int value)
Set the maximum angle in degrees. Like the setDegreeMin() method, this value will be linked to the setValueMax() method. When the paramter is at or above the max value, then the angle of the needle will be set to this value.

Parameters:
value - IN - the maximum needle angle in degrees.

getDegreeMax

the max angle in degrees.

value - IN - the max value.
